Directory.description: Defines the input and output directories and filenames for the slicing and printing process.

input_directory.description: Base directory for input STL files

input_name.description: Name of the input STL file (without data type)

output_directory.description: Base directory for storing output files (will be created if not already available)

output_name.description: Name of the output folder and files as well as .src top line

Robot.description: Settings specific to the robot, including dimensions, tool orientation, and motion parameters. If new categories ar defined inside this .json file, with [category_name][value], they can be referenced in [Robot][start_code] or [Robot][end_code] with {category_name}; only names with letters and numbers seperated by '_' are valid

geometry.description: measurement of robot arm & offset [mm] in accordance with to Brandstötter et. al [https://de.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/fileexchange/48468-inverse-kinematics-of-serial-robots-with-wrist?s%5C_tid=prof%5C_contriblnk]

base_coordinates.description: Coordinate frame ($ROBOTROOT) in the robot's workspace relative to $BASE (coordinate system of printbed) in [mm]; Delta given from $BASE to $ROBOTROOT; This leads to T($BASE,$ROBOTROOT) due to order of rotation being ZYX; example: '{"X": 1460.9, "Y": -2237.66, "Z": 268.5, "A": 0.0, "B": 0.0, "C": 0.0}'

tool_offset.description: Tool offset from $NULLFRAME (flange of robot hand) in direction of $NULLFRAME in [mm]; This leads to T($NULLFRAME,$TCP) as no rotation is involved

tool_orientation.description: Tool orientation relative to $BASE/$FRAME (coordinate system of printbed) in [deg]; This leads to R($BASE/$FRAME,$TCP); A(angle related to Z), B(angle related to Y), C(angle related to Z)

start_position.description: Start position of the robot (joint angles in [deg]); Outside of printbed; example: '{"A1": 75.0, "A2": -90.0, "A3": 90.0, "A4": 0.0, "A5": 90.0, "A6": 0.0}'

end_position.description: End position of the robot (joint angles in [deg]);Outside of printbed; example: '{"A1": 75.0, "A2": -90.0, "A3": 90.0, "A4": 0.0, "A5": 90.0, "A6": 0.0}'

rotation_limit.description: Limit angles of robot axis for each joint in [deg]; valid rotation is between those angles

rotation_sign.description: value defining positiv rotation direction of axis; 1 along z-axis definition, -1 against z-axis definition

rotation_offset.description: defines rotational in [deg] offset along robot rotation definition to match 'Brandstötter et al.'

base_radius.description: Radius [mm] around A1 axis of rotation; ensures the robot head never intersects with its own base (around joint axis A1)

split_src.description: Defines if the krl file is split into multiple files; file_name_000 contains main file, file_name_00n-nnn contain each layer (up to 999 layers)

start_code.description: Robot start code;keys inside 'Robot' section  referenced with ?category_name? and the corresponding value wil formatted and inserted; only names with letters and numbers seperated by '_' are valid
value: GLOBAL INTERRUPT DECL 3 WHEN $STOPMESS==TRUE DO IR_STOPM ( )

end_code.description: Robot end code;If new categories ar defined inside this .json file, with [category_name][value], they can be referenced with {category_name}; only names with letters and numbers seperated by '_' are valid

bed_size.description: Size of the robot bed in mm along X, Y, and Z axes; Sets bedsize for slicing process

print_speed.description: Printing speed of the robot in [m/s]

travel_speed.description: Travel speed of the robot in [m/s]

type_number.description: sets int for each type in the Rhino section to be displayed in the src file

3dm_file.description: path to the 3dm file (native Rhino file) of the robot or whole robot cell; The 3dm file will be imported according to the given position in accordance to $BASE; Make sure that the robot is placed on the origin of the file with the global x,y,z axis co-linear to the orientation of joint A1

min_layer_time.description: minimum layer time in [ms]; .src file includes timer block for each layer and robot has to wait till timer > min_layer-time; set to 0 to deactivate

Pump.description: Gives necessary information on Pump capability and technical data

retract.description: States if pump is capable of retraction; This will include retract moves from generated G-Code

characteristic_curve.description: Gives the function of RPM to Flow[liters/min] of the Pump in [Flow,RPM,Voltage]

pump_control.description: Setup if the signal from the external axis of robot should be RPM (true) or Voltage (false)

linetype_flow.description: Flow compensation for each linetype in [%]; 100 = flow within spec; 120 = account for under extrusion; 90 = account for over extrusion

slicer_name.description: define the slicer used (necessary to decode G-Code); Available options: Cura, Orca, Open Slicer

cura_cmd_path.description: Path to CURA's executable file; Example: C:\...\CuraEngine.exe

cura_printer_config_file_path.description: Path to CURA's printer configuration file; https://github.com/Ultimaker/Cura/wiki/Definition-Files-Explained; store the extruder.def.json file in the same folder; Example: C:\...\TUM_C3DP_fdmprinter.def.json

cura_arguments.description: Additional arguments to quickly change the settings for CURA slicing. These overwrite the values in the printer and extruder config data

cura_scaling.description: Sets scaling (s) and rotation (r) values for X,Y and Z axis in [%] and [deg] relativ to printbed origin

cura_line_types_dict.description: Defines Line Types (ensures a clear assignment of printline-types from different slicers)

orca_printer_config_file_path.description: Path to ORCA's printer configuration file; https://github.com/Ultimaker/Cura/wiki/Definition-Files-Explained; store the extruder.def.json file in the same folder

orca_arguments.description: Additional arguments to quickly change the settings for ORCA slicing. These overwrite the values in the printer and extruder config data

orca_scaling.description: Sets scaling (s) and rotation (r) values for X,Y and Z axis in [%] and [deg] relativ to printbed origin

orca_line_types_dict.description: Defines Line Types (ensures a clear assignment of printline-types from different slicers)

point_print.description: defines if every individual point of the Gcode gets drawn in the Rhino file; false only draws start-, end-, protract- and retract-points

point_color.description: Sets color for each point in the Rhino file

line_style_line.description: defines displayed linetype in Rhino for available types of printed line. Available display types: solid, dashed, dotted, dashdot

line_types_color.description: Defines the color in #hex code of the printed line in the Rhino file;

line_width.description: Sets linewidth [mm] of each linetype for Print Preview (solid, dashed, dotted, dash_dot); gets overwritten by extrusion width if line is a printline
